25.description: Significant, Separately Identifiable Evaluation and Management Service by the Same Physician on the Same Day of the Procedure or Other Service
25.usage: When an E/M service is performed on the same day as a procedure or other service
rules: Must be appended to E/M codes only
Indicates a significant, separately identifiable E/M service
Different diagnosis or separate documented service required
Cannot be used with preventive medicine codes (99381-99397)
common_errors: Using when procedure is inherent to E/M

50.usage: When identical procedures are performed on both sides of the body during the same operative session
rules: Only for procedures that can be performed bilaterally
Both procedures must be performed during same session
Payment is typically 150% of single procedure
Cannot be used with codes already designated as bilateral

51.usage: When multiple procedures are performed at the same session by the same provider
rules: Apply to secondary and additional procedures
Secondary procedures typically reimbursed at reduced rate (50-80%)
Some payers may not require this modifier

52.usage: When a service or procedure is partially reduced or eliminated at the physician's discretion
rules: Indicates service was less than usually required
Cannot be used with E/M codes

53.usage: When a physician elects to terminate a surgical or diagnostic procedure due to extenuating circumstances or those that threaten the well-being of the patient
rules: Only for procedures started but not completed
Patient safety must be the reason

59.usage: Identify procedures/services that are not normally reported together, but are appropriate under the circumstances
rules: Only when no other modifier describes the situation
Must document why procedures are distinct
Different session, different procedure/surgery, different site, separate incision, separate lesion, or separate injury
common_errors: Using when X{EPSU} modifiers are more appropriate

76.description: Repeat Procedure or Service by Same Physician or Other Qualified Health Care Professional
76.usage: When a procedure or service is repeated by the same physician on the same day
rules: For procedures repeated on the same day

77.description: Repeat Procedure by Another Physician or Other Qualified Health Care Professional
77.usage: When a procedure or service is repeated by a different physician on the same day
rules: For procedures repeated on the same day

78.description: Unplanned Return to the Operating/Procedure Room by the Same Physician Following Initial Procedure for a Related Procedure During the Postoperative Period
78.usage: When patient returns for related complication during postoperative period
rules: Must be during global postoperative period

79.description: Unrelated Procedure or Service by the Same Physician During the Postoperative Period
79.usage: When an unrelated procedure is performed during the postoperative period of another procedure
rules: Must be during global postoperative period
Documentation must show procedures are unrelated

91.usage: When a laboratory test is repeated on the same day to obtain subsequent results
rules: Cannot be used for specimen re-runs

95.description: Synchronous Telemedicine Service Rendered Via Real-Time Interactive Audio and Video Telecommunications System

AI.usage: Identify the physician who oversees the patient's care
common_errors: Multiple physicians using for same patient

LT.usage: Identify procedures performed on the left side of the body
rules: Must specify left side in documentation

RT.usage: Identify procedures performed on the right side of the body
rules: Must specify right side in documentation

XE.usage: Service is distinct because it occurred during a separate encounter on the same date

XP.usage: Service is distinct because it was performed by a different practitioner

XS.usage: Service is distinct because it was performed on a separate organ/structure

XU.usage: Service is distinct because it does not overlap usual components of the main service
rules: Use when no other X modifier applies

TC.usage: When only the technical portion of a procedure is performed
rules: For procedures with professional and technical components
common_errors: Using on codes without component split

26.usage: When only the professional portion of a procedure is performed
rules: For procedures with professional and technical components
Cannot be used with modifier TC
common_errors: Using on codes without component split
